required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Expected Length of Hospital Stay Using Machine Learning
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Expected Length of Hospital Stay Using Machine Learning

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective observational study drawing on data from the Brigham and Women's Home Hospital database. Sociodemographic and clinic data from a training cohort were used to train a machine learning algorithm to predict length of stay throughout a patient's admission. This algorithm was then validated in a validation cohort.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of admission to date of discharge (1 to 24 days)
primary_outcome.description: The time spent by each patient in Home Hospital from time of admission to time of discharge, measured in hours

arm_group.description: A subset of patients that are used to train the machine learning algorithm.
A subset of patients that are "held back" and used to validate the algorithm's accuracy.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects admitted at Brigham and Women's Hospital and Brigham and Women's Faulkner Hospital who meet primary diagnosis, age, and residence within 5 mile requirements and are enrolled in home hospital.

criteria.textblock: Was a subject in the Brigham and Women's Home Hospital study and has a completed record in the study's database.
